item.title: SoftBank cuts stake in Ola Electric by 2.15%, now owns 15.68%

review.headline_rewrite: SoftBank cuts stake in Ola Electric by 2.15%, now owns 15.68%
bullets: Japan’s SoftBank Group has offloaded a 2.15% stake in electric scooter maker Ola Electric through open-market transactions, an exchange filing showed on Thursday.
Between July 15, 2025, and September 2, 2025, SoftBank sold 94.9 million shares in a series of transactions, reducing its stake in the company
According to Trendlyne data, this marks SoftBank’s first stake sale since Ola Electric’s IPO in August 2024.
Despite the sale, SoftBank remains the second-largest shareholder in the company, behind founder and chairman Bhavish Aggarwal, who held a 30.02% stake as of

item.title: Mirae Asset Mutual Fund trims stake in Syngene International to 2.95%. Details here

review.headline_rewrite: Mirae Asset Mutual Fund trims stake in Syngene International to 2.95%. Details here
bullets: Mirae Asset Mutual Fund has marginally trimmed its stake in Syngene International, according to the latest shareholding disclosures.
On September 2, the fund sold 667,386 shares, or a 0.16% stake, in Syngene International through open-market transactions, reducing its stake to 2.95% from
At the end of the June quarter, 29 mutual funds held a collective stake of 20.70% in the company.
